sentences.zh: 」因與由余曲席而坐，傳器而食，問其地形與其兵勢盡察，而後令內史廖以女樂二八遺戎王。

translations.text: He then sat with You Yu on adjacent mats, shared dishes with him, and inquired thoroughly about the terrain and military situation. Afterward, he had Palace Scribe Liao send sixteen female musicians to the Rong king.

sentences.zh: 戎王受而說之，終年不還。

translations.text: The Rong king accepted them and was delighted; he did not return for a whole year.

sentences.zh: 於是秦乃歸由余。

translations.text: Qin then sent You Yu back.

sentences.zh: 由余數諫不聽，繆公又數使人閒要由余，由余遂去降秦。

translations.text: You Yu remonstrated several times but was not heeded. Duke Mu also sent people several times to secretly invite You Yu, and You Yu eventually defected to Qin.

sentences.zh: 繆公以客禮禮之，問伐戎之形。

translations.text: Duke Mu treated him with the courtesy due a guest and asked him about the situation for attacking the Rong.

The king of the Rong sent You Yu to Qin. You Yu's ancestors were people of Jin who had fled to the Rong, and he could speak the Jin language. Hearing that Duke Mu was worthy, he sent You Yu to observe Qin. Duke Mu of Qin showed him the palaces and storehouses. You Yu said: 'If spirits made these, then the spirits have been wearied. If men made these, then the people have been oppressed.' Duke Mu was surprised and asked: 'The Central States use the Odes, Documents, rites, music, and laws to govern, yet they still have disorder from time to time. Now the Rong and Yi have none of these; how do they govern? Is it not difficult?' You Yu laughed and said: 'This is precisely why the Central States are in disorder. From the time when the sage Huangdi created rites, music, and laws, and practiced them himself, there was barely minor order. By subsequent generations, they became daily more arrogant and dissolute. They relied on the authority of laws to demand service from their subordinates. When the subordinates were exhausted, they resented the superiors on grounds of humanity and righteousness. Superiors and subordinates fought and resented each other, leading to usurpation and regicide until whole clans were exterminated. All such cases belong to this pattern. The Rong and Yi are not like this. Superiors embrace simple virtue in treating their subordinates; subordinates cherish loyalty and trust in serving their superiors. The government of the whole state is like the governance of one body. They do not know by what means they govern; this is truly the government of sages.' Duke Mu withdrew and asked the Palace Scribe Liao: 'I have heard that when a neighboring state has a sage, it is a worry for rival states. Now You Yu is worthy; he is a threat to me. What shall I do about it?' Palace Scribe Liao said: 'The Rong king dwells in a remote place and has not heard the sounds of the Central States. Try sending him female musicians to beguile his mind; request You Yu for him, to create a rift between them; detain him and do not send him back, so that he misses his deadline. The Rong king will find this strange and will certainly suspect You Yu. When there is a rift between ruler and minister, he can be captured. Moreover, if the Rong king loves music, he will certainly neglect government.' Duke Mu said: 'Good.' He then sat with You Yu on adjacent mats, shared dishes with him, and inquired thoroughly about the terrain and military situation. Afterward, he had Palace Scribe Liao send sixteen female musicians to the Rong king. The Rong king accepted them and was delighted; he did not return for a whole year. Qin then sent You Yu back. You Yu remonstrated several times but was not heeded. Duke Mu also sent people several times to secretly invite You Yu, and You Yu eventually defected to Qin. Duke Mu treated him with the courtesy due a guest and asked him about the situation for attacking the Rong.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，繆公復益厚孟明等，使將兵伐晉，渡河焚船，大敗晉人，取王官及鄗，以報殽之役。

translations.text: In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Mu again treated Mengming and the others even more generously, and sent them to lead troops against Jin. They crossed the river, burned their boats, and utterly defeated the Jin forces, capturing Wangguan and Hao to avenge the battle of Xiao.

sentences.zh: 晉人皆城守不敢出。

translations.text: The Jin people all defended their cities and dared not come out.

sentences.zh: 於是繆公乃自茅津渡河，封殽中尸，為發喪，哭之三日。

translations.text: Duke Mu then crossed the river himself at Maojin, collected the corpses at Xiao, held funeral rites for them, and mourned for three days.

sentences.zh: 乃誓於軍曰：「嗟士卒！

translations.text: He then made an oath to the army, saying: 'Alas, soldiers!

sentences.zh: 聽無譁，余誓告汝。

translations.text: Listen without clamor; I make this sworn declaration to you.

sentences.zh: 古之人謀黃髪番番，則無所過。

translations.text: The ancients sought counsel from the experienced and white-haired, and thus made no mistakes.'

sentences.zh: 」以申思不用蹇叔、百里傒之謀，故作此誓，令後世以記余過。

translations.text: He made this oath because he reflected with remorse on not having followed the counsel of Jian Shu and Baili Xi, so that later generations might remember his error.

sentences.zh: 君子聞之，皆為垂涕，曰：「嗟乎！

translations.text: When gentlemen heard of this, they all shed tears and said: 'Alas!

sentences.zh: 秦繆公之與人周也，卒得孟明之慶。

translations.text: Duke Mu of Qin was so thorough in his treatment of others that he finally obtained the good fortune of Mengming.'

In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Mu again treated Mengming and the others even more generously, and sent them to lead troops against Jin. They crossed the river, burned their boats, and utterly defeated the Jin forces, capturing Wangguan and Hao to avenge the battle of Xiao. The Jin people all defended their cities and dared not come out. Duke Mu then crossed the river himself at Maojin, collected the corpses at Xiao, held funeral rites for them, and mourned for three days. He then made an oath to the army, saying: 'Alas, soldiers! Listen without clamor; I make this sworn declaration to you. The ancients sought counsel from the experienced and white-haired, and thus made no mistakes.' He made this oath because he reflected with remorse on not having followed the counsel of Jian Shu and Baili Xi, so that later generations might remember his error. When gentlemen heard of this, they all shed tears and said: 'Alas! Duke Mu of Qin was so thorough in his treatment of others that he finally obtained the good fortune of Mengming.'

sentences.zh: 三十七年，秦用由余謀伐戎王，益國十二，開地千里，遂霸西戎。

translations.text: In the thirty-seventh year, following You Yu's strategy, Qin attacked the Rong king, annexed twelve states, expanded its territory by a thousand li, and thus became hegemon over the Western Rong.

sentences.zh: 天子使召公過賀繆公以金鼓。

translations.text: The Son of Heaven sent Duke Zhao to congratulate Duke Mu with bronze drums.

sentences.zh: 三十九年，繆公卒，葬雍。

translations.text: In the thirty-ninth year, Duke Mu died and was buried at Yong.

sentences.zh: 從死者百七十七人，秦之良臣子輿氏三人名曰奄息、仲行、鍼虎，亦在從死之中。

translations.text: One hundred and seventy-seven people were sacrificed to accompany him in death, including three of Qin's finest ministers from the Ziyu clan, named Yanxi, Zhonghang, and Zhenhu, who were among those sacrificed.

sentences.zh: 秦人哀之，為作歌黃鳥之詩。

translations.text: The people of Qin mourned them and composed the poem 'Yellow Bird.'

sentences.zh: 君子曰：「秦繆公廣地益國，東服彊晉，西霸戎夷，然不為諸侯盟主，亦宜哉。

translations.text: The gentleman said: 'Duke Mu of Qin expanded his territory and enlarged his state, subjugating mighty Jin in the east and becoming hegemon over the Rong and Yi in the west. Yet he did not become leader of the feudal lords' covenants, and rightly so.

sentences.zh: 死而棄民，收其良臣而從死。

translations.text: When he died, he abandoned his people and had his finest ministers sacrificed to accompany him.

sentences.zh: 且先王崩，尚猶遺德垂法，況奪之善人良臣百姓所哀者乎？

translations.text: When former kings died, they still left behind virtue and handed down laws. How much worse is it to take away the good men and loyal ministers whom the people mourned?

sentences.zh: 是以知秦不能復東征也。

translations.text: From this one can tell that Qin would not be able to campaign eastward again.'

sentences.zh: 」繆公子四十人，其太子嵤代立，是為康公。

translations.text: Duke Mu had forty sons; his heir apparent Yong succeeded him. This was Duke Kang.

In the thirty-seventh year, following You Yu's strategy, Qin attacked the Rong king, annexed twelve states, expanded its territory by a thousand li, and thus became hegemon over the Western Rong. The Son of Heaven sent Duke Zhao to congratulate Duke Mu with bronze drums. In the thirty-ninth year, Duke Mu died and was buried at Yong. One hundred and seventy-seven people were sacrificed to accompany him in death, including three of Qin's finest ministers from the Ziyu clan, named Yanxi, Zhonghang, and Zhenhu, who were among those sacrificed. The people of Qin mourned them and composed the poem 'Yellow Bird.' The gentleman said: 'Duke Mu of Qin expanded his territory and enlarged his state, subjugating mighty Jin in the east and becoming hegemon over the Rong and Yi in the west. Yet he did not become leader of the feudal lords' covenants, and rightly so. When he died, he abandoned his people and had his finest ministers sacrificed to accompany him. When former kings died, they still left behind virtue and handed down laws. How much worse is it to take away the good men and loyal ministers whom the people mourned? From this one can tell that Qin would not be able to campaign eastward again.' Duke Mu had forty sons; his heir apparent Yong succeeded him. This was Duke Kang.

sentences.zh: 康公元年。

translations.text: In the first year of Duke Kang.

sentences.zh: 往歲繆公之卒，晉襄公亦卒；

translations.text: In the previous year when Duke Mu died, Duke Xiang of Jin also died;

sentences.zh: 襄公之弟名雍，秦出也，在秦。

translations.text: Duke Xiang's younger brother, named Yong, was born of a Qin mother and was in Qin.

sentences.zh: 晉趙盾欲立之，使隨會來迎雍，秦以兵送至令狐。

translations.text: Zhao Dun of Jin wanted to establish him as ruler and sent Sui Hui to welcome Yong. Qin escorted him with troops to Linghu.

sentences.zh: 晉立襄公子而反擊秦師，秦師敗，隨會來奔。

translations.text: Jin established Duke Xiang's son instead and attacked the Qin army. The Qin army was defeated, and Sui Hui came to Qin.

sentences.zh: 二年，秦伐晉，取武城，報令狐之役。

translations.text: In the second year, Qin attacked Jin and captured Wucheng, in retaliation for the Linghu affair.

sentences.zh: 四年，晉伐秦，取少梁。

translations.text: In the fourth year, Jin attacked Qin and captured Shaoliang.

sentences.zh: 六年，秦伐晉，取羈馬。

translations.text: In the sixth year, Qin attacked Jin and captured Jima.

sentences.zh: 戰於河曲，大敗晉軍。

translations.text: They fought at Hequ and utterly defeated the Jin army.

sentences.zh: 晉人患隨會在秦為亂，乃使魏讎餘詳反，合謀會，詐而得會，會遂歸晉。

translations.text: The Jin people were troubled that Sui Hui was in Qin causing disorder, so they sent Wei Chouyou to feign defection and conspire with Sui Hui. By deception they secured Sui Hui, who then returned to Jin.

sentences.zh: 康公立十二年卒，子共公立。

translations.text: Duke Kang reigned for twelve years and died; his son Duke Gong succeeded him.

In the first year of Duke Kang. In the previous year when Duke Mu died, Duke Xiang of Jin also died; Duke Xiang's younger brother, named Yong, was born of a Qin mother and was in Qin. Zhao Dun of Jin wanted to establish him as ruler and sent Sui Hui to welcome Yong. Qin escorted him with troops to Linghu. Jin established Duke Xiang's son instead and attacked the Qin army. The Qin army was defeated, and Sui Hui came to Qin. In the second year, Qin attacked Jin and captured Wucheng, in retaliation for the Linghu affair. In the fourth year, Jin attacked Qin and captured Shaoliang. In the sixth year, Qin attacked Jin and captured Jima. They fought at Hequ and utterly defeated the Jin army. The Jin people were troubled that Sui Hui was in Qin causing disorder, so they sent Wei Chouyou to feign defection and conspire with Sui Hui. By deception they secured Sui Hui, who then returned to Jin. Duke Kang reigned for twelve years and died; his son Duke Gong succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 共公二年，晉趙穿弒其君靈公。

translations.text: In the second year of Duke Gong, Zhao Chuan of Jin assassinated his ruler Duke Ling.

sentences.zh: 三年，楚莊王彊，北兵至雒，問周鼎。

translations.text: In the third year, King Zhuang of Chu was powerful; his northern army reached Luo and inquired about the Zhou tripods.

sentences.zh: 共公立五年卒，子桓公立。

translations.text: Duke Gong reigned for five years and died; his son Duke Huan succeeded him.

In the second year of Duke Gong, Zhao Chuan of Jin assassinated his ruler Duke Ling. In the third year, King Zhuang of Chu was powerful; his northern army reached Luo and inquired about the Zhou tripods. Duke Gong reigned for five years and died; his son Duke Huan succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 桓公三年，晉敗我一將。

translations.text: In the third year of Duke Huan, Jin defeated one of our generals.

sentences.zh: 十年，楚莊王服鄭，北敗晉兵於河上。

translations.text: In the tenth year, King Zhuang of Chu subdued Zheng and defeated the Jin army north of the river.

sentences.zh: 當是之時，楚霸，為會盟合諸侯。

translations.text: At this time, Chu was hegemon and convened meetings and covenants with the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，晉厲公初立，與秦桓公夾河而盟。

translations.text: In the twenty-fourth year, when Duke Li of Jin first ascended the throne, he and Duke Huan of Qin made a covenant with the Yellow River between them.

sentences.zh: 歸而秦倍盟，與翟合謀擊晉。

translations.text: Upon returning, Qin broke the covenant and conspired with the Di to attack Jin.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，晉率諸侯伐秦，秦軍敗走，追至涇而還。

translations.text: In the twenty-sixth year, Jin led the feudal lords in attacking Qin. The Qin army was defeated and fled; the pursuers reached the Jing River and then returned.

sentences.zh: 桓公立二十七年卒，子景公立。

translations.text: Duke Huan reigned for twenty-seven years and died; his son Duke Jing succeeded him.

In the third year of Duke Huan, Jin defeated one of our generals. In the tenth year, King Zhuang of Chu subdued Zheng and defeated the Jin army north of the river. At this time, Chu was hegemon and convened meetings and covenants with the feudal lords. In the twenty-fourth year, when Duke Li of Jin first ascended the throne, he and Duke Huan of Qin made a covenant with the Yellow River between them. Upon returning, Qin broke the covenant and conspired with the Di to attack Jin. In the twenty-sixth year, Jin led the feudal lords in attacking Qin. The Qin army was defeated and fled; the pursuers reached the Jing River and then returned. Duke Huan reigned for twenty-seven years and died; his son Duke Jing succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 景公四年，晉欒書弒其君厲公。

translations.text: In the fourth year of Duke Jing, Luan Shu of Jin assassinated his ruler Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 十五年，救鄭，敗晉兵於櫟。

translations.text: In the fifteenth year, he rescued Zheng and defeated the Jin army at Li.

sentences.zh: 是時晉悼公為盟主。

translations.text: At this time Duke Dao of Jin was covenant leader.

sentences.zh: 十八年，晉悼公彊，數會諸侯，率以伐秦，敗秦軍。

translations.text: In the eighteenth year, Duke Dao of Jin was powerful and frequently convened meetings of the feudal lords, leading them to attack Qin and defeating the Qin army.

sentences.zh: 秦軍走，晉兵追之，遂渡涇，至棫林而還。

translations.text: The Qin army fled and the Jin army pursued, crossing the Jing River and reaching Yulin before returning.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，景公如晉，與平公盟，已而背之。

translations.text: In the twenty-seventh year, Duke Jing went to Jin and made a covenant with Duke Ping, but then broke it.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，楚公子圍弒其君而自立，是為靈王。

translations.text: In the thirty-sixth year, Prince Wei of Chu assassinated his ruler and made himself king; this was King Ling.

sentences.zh: 景公母弟後子鍼有寵，景公母弟富，或譖之，恐誅，乃奔晉，車重千乘。

translations.text: Duke Jing's maternal younger brother Houzi Zhen was favored. Duke Jing's maternal younger brother was wealthy. Someone slandered him, and fearing execution, he fled to Jin with a thousand chariots of baggage.

sentences.zh: 晉平公曰：「后子富如此，何以自亡？

translations.text: Duke Ping of Jin said: 'Houzi is so wealthy; why did he flee?'

sentences.zh: 」對曰：「秦公無道，畏誅，欲待其後世乃歸。

translations.text: He replied: 'The Duke of Qin is unprincipled. Fearing execution, I wish to wait for a later generation before returning.'

sentences.zh: 」三十九年，楚靈王彊，會諸侯於申，為盟主，殺齊慶封。

translations.text: In the thirty-ninth year, King Ling of Chu was powerful. He convened the feudal lords at Shen, became covenant leader, and executed Qing Feng of Qi.

sentences.zh: 景公立四十年卒，子哀公立。

translations.text: Duke Jing reigned for forty years and died; his son Duke Ai succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 后子復來歸秦。

translations.text: Houzi returned to Qin.

In the fourth year of Duke Jing, Luan Shu of Jin assassinated his ruler Duke Li. In the fifteenth year, he rescued Zheng and defeated the Jin army at Li. At this time Duke Dao of Jin was covenant leader. In the eighteenth year, Duke Dao of Jin was powerful and frequently convened meetings of the feudal lords, leading them to attack Qin and defeating the Qin army. The Qin army fled and the Jin army pursued, crossing the Jing River and reaching Yulin before returning. In the twenty-seventh year, Duke Jing went to Jin and made a covenant with Duke Ping, but then broke it. Duke Ping of Jin said: 'Houzi is so wealthy; why did he flee?' He replied: 'The Duke of Qin is unprincipled. Fearing execution, I wish to wait for a later generation before returning.' In the thirty-ninth year, King Ling of Chu was powerful. He convened the feudal lords at Shen, became covenant leader, and executed Qing Feng of Qi. Duke Jing reigned for forty years and died; his son Duke Ai succeeded him. Houzi returned to Qin.

sentences.zh: 哀公八年，楚公子棄疾弒靈王而自立，是為平王。

translations.text: In the eighth year of Duke Ai, Prince Qiji of Chu assassinated King Ling and made himself king; this was King Ping.

sentences.zh: 十一年，楚平王來求秦女為太子建妻。

translations.text: In the eleventh year, King Ping of Chu came to request a Qin woman as a wife for his heir apparent Jian.

sentences.zh: 至國，女好而自娶之。

translations.text: When she arrived in the state, she was beautiful, so he took her for himself.

sentences.zh: 十五年，楚平王欲誅建，建亡；

translations.text: In the fifteenth year, King Ping of Chu wanted to execute Jian, but Jian fled;

sentences.zh: 伍子胥奔吳。

translations.text: Wu Zixu fled to Wu.

sentences.zh: 晉公室卑而六卿彊，欲內相攻，是以久秦晉不相攻。

translations.text: The Jin ducal house was weak while the Six Ministers were powerful; they wanted to fight among themselves internally. This is why Qin and Jin did not attack each other for a long time.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，吳王闔閭與伍子胥伐楚，楚王亡奔隨，吳遂入郢。

translations.text: In the thirty-first year, King Helü of Wu and Wu Zixu attacked Chu. The king of Chu fled to Sui, and Wu then entered Ying.

sentences.zh: 楚大夫申包胥來告急，七日不食，日夜哭泣。

translations.text: The Chu minister Shen Baoxu came to report the emergency. For seven days he did not eat, weeping day and night.

sentences.zh: 於是秦乃發五百乘救楚，敗吳師。

translations.text: Qin then dispatched five hundred chariots to rescue Chu and defeated the Wu army.

sentences.zh: 吳師歸，楚昭王乃得復入郢。

translations.text: The Wu army withdrew, and King Zhao of Chu was then able to return to Ying.

sentences.zh: 哀公立三十六年卒。

translations.text: Duke Ai reigned for thirty-six years and died.

sentences.zh: 太子夷公，夷公蚤死，不得立，立夷公子，是為惠公。

translations.text: His heir apparent was Yi Gong. Yi Gong died young and could not succeed; Yi Gong's son was established. This was Duke Hui.

In the eighth year of Duke Ai, Prince Qiji of Chu assassinated King Ling and made himself king; this was King Ping. In the eleventh year, King Ping of Chu came to request a Qin woman as a wife for his heir apparent Jian. When she arrived in the state, she was beautiful, so he took her for himself. In the fifteenth year, King Ping of Chu wanted to execute Jian, but Jian fled; Wu Zixu fled to Wu. The Jin ducal house was weak while the Six Ministers were powerful; they wanted to fight among themselves internally. This is why Qin and Jin did not attack each other for a long time. In the thirty-first year, King Helü of Wu and Wu Zixu attacked Chu. The king of Chu fled to Sui, and Wu then entered Ying. The Chu minister Shen Baoxu came to report the emergency. For seven days he did not eat, weeping day and night. Qin then dispatched five hundred chariots to rescue Chu and defeated the Wu army. The Wu army withdrew, and King Zhao of Chu was then able to return to Ying. Duke Ai reigned for thirty-six years and died. His heir apparent was Yi Gong. Yi Gong died young and could not succeed; Yi Gong's son was established. This was Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 惠公元年，孔子行魯相事。

translations.text: In the first year of Duke Hui, Confucius acted as prime minister of Lu.

sentences.zh: 五年，晉卿中行、范氏反晉，晉使智氏、趙簡子攻之，范、中行氏亡奔齊。

translations.text: In the fifth year, the Jin ministers Zhonghang and Fan rebelled against Jin. Jin sent the Zhi clan and Zhao Jianzi to attack them. The Fan and Zhonghang clans were defeated and fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 惠公立十年卒，子悼公立。

translations.text: Duke Hui reigned for ten years and died; his son Duke Dao succeeded him.

In the first year of Duke Xiao, there were six powerful states east of the mountains and rivers: Duke Wei of Qi, King Xuan of Chu, King Hui of Wei, Duke Dao of Yan, Marquis Ai of Han, and Marquis Cheng of Zhao were contemporaries. There were more than ten small states between the Huai and Si rivers. Chu and Wei shared borders with Qin. Wei built a long wall, from Zheng along the Luo River northward, possessing Shangjun. Chu extended from Hanzhong, with Ba and Qianzhong in the south. The Zhou royal house was weak, and the feudal lords governed by force, competing to annex each other. Qin was remote in Yongzhou, excluded from the meetings and covenants of the Central States' feudal lords, and treated like the Yi and Di barbarians. Duke Xiao therefore spread benevolence, supported orphans and widows, recruited warriors, and made clear the rewards for merit. He issued an order throughout the state: 'Formerly, our Duke Mu, between Qi and Yong, cultivated virtue and practiced warfare, pacified Jin's troubles in the east using the river as boundary, became hegemon over the Rong and Di in the west, expanded territory by a thousand li, was honored by the Son of Heaven as hegemon, was congratulated by all the feudal lords, and opened a glorious and beautiful enterprise for later generations. It happened that in the past, under Duke Li, Duke Zao, Duke Jian, and Chuzi, there was no peace. The state had internal troubles and had no leisure for external affairs. The Three Jin attacked and seized our former rulers' lands west of the river. The feudal lords despise Qin; no humiliation is greater than this. When Duke Xian ascended the throne, he pacified the borders, moved the capital to Liyang, and intended to campaign eastward to recover Duke Mu's former territories and restore Duke Mu's government. I, the lonely one, thinking of our former rulers' intentions, am constantly pained in my heart. If any guest or minister can devise an extraordinary plan to strengthen Qin, I will give him high office and share my territory with him.' Thereupon he sent troops east to besiege Shan city and west to behead the Huan king of the Rong.

sentences.zh: 五年，陰晉人犀首為大良造。

translations.text: In the fifth year, Xishou of Yinjin became Grand Chief Constructor.

sentences.zh: 六年，魏納陰晉，陰晉更名寧秦。

translations.text: In the sixth year, Wei ceded Yinjin; Yinjin was renamed Ningqin.

sentences.zh: 七年，公子卬與魏戰，虜其將龍賈，斬首八萬。

translations.text: In the seventh year, Prince Ang fought with Wei, captured their general Long Jia, and beheaded eighty thousand.

sentences.zh: 八年，魏納河西地。

translations.text: In the eighth year, Wei ceded the lands west of the river.

sentences.zh: 九年，渡河，取汾陰、皮氏。

translations.text: In the ninth year, he crossed the river and captured Fenyin and Pishi.

sentences.zh: 與魏王會應。

translations.text: He met with the king of Wei at Ying.

sentences.zh: 圍焦，降之。

translations.text: He besieged Jiao, which surrendered.

sentences.zh: 十年，張儀相秦。

translations.text: In the tenth year, Zhang Yi became prime minister of Qin.

sentences.zh: 魏納上郡十五縣。

translations.text: Wei ceded fifteen counties of Shangjun.

sentences.zh: 十一年，縣義渠。

translations.text: In the eleventh year, Yiqu was made a county.

sentences.zh: 歸魏焦、曲沃。

translations.text: Jiao and Quwo were returned to Wei.

translations.text: The ruler of Yiqu became a subject.

translations.text: Shaoliang was renamed Xiayang.

sentences.zh: 十二年，初臘。

translations.text: In the twelfth year, the La sacrifice was first instituted.

sentences.zh: 十三年四月戊午，魏君為王，韓亦為王。

translations.text: On the wuwu day of the fourth month of the thirteenth year, the ruler of Wei became king; Han also became a kingdom.

In the fifth year, Xishou of Yinjin became Grand Chief Constructor. In the sixth year, Wei ceded Yinjin; Yinjin was renamed Ningqin. In the seventh year, Prince Ang fought with Wei, captured their general Long Jia, and beheaded eighty thousand. In the eighth year, Wei ceded the lands west of the river. In the ninth year, he crossed the river and captured Fenyin and Pishi. He met with the king of Wei at Ying. He besieged Jiao, which surrendered. In the tenth year, Zhang Yi became prime minister of Qin. Wei ceded fifteen counties of Shangjun. In the eleventh year, Yiqu was made a county. Jiao and Quwo were returned to Wei. The ruler of Yiqu became a subject. Shaoliang was renamed Xiayang. In the twelfth year, the La sacrifice was first instituted. On the wuwu day of the fourth month of the thirteenth year, the ruler of Wei became king; Han also became a kingdom. He sent Zhang Yi to attack and capture Shan, and expelled its people to Wei.

sentences.zh: 十四年，更為元年。

translations.text: In the fourteenth year, a new era was begun.

sentences.zh: 二年，張儀與齊、楚大臣會齧桑。

translations.text: In the second year, Zhang Yi met with senior ministers of Qi and Chu at Niesang.

sentences.zh: 三年，韓、魏太子來朝。

translations.text: In the third year, the heirs apparent of Han and Wei came to pay court.

sentences.zh: 張儀相魏。

translations.text: Zhang Yi became prime minister of Wei.

sentences.zh: 五年，王游至北河。

translations.text: In the fifth year, the king traveled to the Northern River.

sentences.zh: 七年，樂池相秦。

translations.text: In the seventh year, Yue Chi became prime minister of Qin.

sentences.zh: 韓、趙、魏、燕、齊帥匈奴共攻秦。

translations.text: Han, Zhao, Wei, Yan, and Qi led the Xiongnu in a joint attack on Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦使庶長疾與戰修魚，虜其將申差，敗趙公子渴、韓太子奐，斬首八萬二千。

translations.text: Qin sent the Senior Minister Shuchang Ji to fight them at Xiuyu. He captured their general Shen Chai, defeated Prince Ke of Zhao and the heir apparent Huan of Han, and beheaded eighty-two thousand.

sentences.zh: 八年，張儀復相秦。

translations.text: In the eighth year, Zhang Yi again became prime minister of Qin.

sentences.zh: 九年，司馬錯伐蜀，滅之。

translations.text: In the ninth year, Sima Cuo attacked Shu and destroyed it.

sentences.zh: 伐取趙中都、西陽十年，韓太子蒼來質。

translations.text: He attacked and captured Zhongdu and Xiyang of Zhao. In the tenth year, the heir apparent Cang of Han came as hostage.

sentences.zh: 伐取韓石章。

translations.text: He attacked and captured Shizhang of Han.

sentences.zh: 伐敗趙將泥。

translations.text: He attacked and defeated the Zhao general Ni.

sentences.zh: 伐取義渠二十五城。

translations.text: He attacked and captured twenty-five cities from Yiqu.

sentences.zh: 十一年，摢裏疾攻魏焦，降之。

translations.text: In the eleventh year, Hui Li Ji attacked Wei's Jiao, which surrendered.

sentences.zh: 敗韓岸門，斬首萬，其將犀首走。

translations.text: He defeated Han at Anmen, beheading ten thousand; their general Xishou fled.

sentences.zh: 公子通封於蜀。

translations.text: Prince Tong was enfeoffed in Shu.

sentences.zh: 燕君讓其臣子之。

translations.text: The ruler of Yan yielded to his minister Zizhi.

sentences.zh: 十二年，王與梁王會臨晉。

translations.text: In the twelfth year, the king met with the king of Liang at Linjin.

sentences.zh: 庶長疾攻趙，虜趙將莊。

translations.text: The Senior Minister Shuchang Ji attacked Zhao and captured the Zhao general Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 張儀相楚。

translations.text: Zhang Yi became prime minister of Chu.

sentences.zh: 十三年，庶長章擊楚於丹陽，虜其將屈丐，斬首八萬；

translations.text: In the thirteenth year, the Senior Minister Shuchang Zhang attacked Chu at Danyang, captured their general Qu Gai, and beheaded eighty thousand;

sentences.zh: 又攻楚漢中，取地六百里，置漢中郡。

translations.text: he also attacked Chu's Hanzhong, seized six hundred li of territory, and established the Hanzhong commandery.

sentences.zh: 楚圍雍氏，秦使庶長疾助韓而東攻齊，到滿助魏攻燕。

translations.text: Chu besieged Yongshi. Qin sent the Senior Minister Shuchang Ji to aid Han and attack Qi eastward, and sent Dao Man to aid Wei in attacking Yan.

sentences.zh: 十四年，伐楚，取召陵。

translations.text: In the fourteenth year, he attacked Chu and captured Zhaoling.

sentences.zh: 丹、犁臣，蜀相壯殺蜀侯來降。

translations.text: Dan and Li submitted. The Shu minister Zhuang killed the Marquis of Shu and came to surrender.

In the fourteenth year, a new era was begun. In the second year, Zhang Yi met with senior ministers of Qi and Chu at Niesang. In the third year, the heirs apparent of Han and Wei came to pay court. Zhang Yi became prime minister of Wei. In the fifth year, the king traveled to the Northern River. In the seventh year, Yue Chi became prime minister of Qin. Han, Zhao, Wei, Yan, and Qi led the Xiongnu in a joint attack on Qin. Qin sent the Senior Minister Shuchang Ji to fight them at Xiuyu. He captured their general Shen Chai, defeated Prince Ke of Zhao and the heir apparent Huan of Han, and beheaded eighty-two thousand. In the eighth year, Zhang Yi again became prime minister of Qin. In the ninth year, Sima Cuo attacked Shu and destroyed it. He attacked and captured Zhongdu and Xiyang of Zhao. In the tenth year, the heir apparent Cang of Han came as hostage. He attacked and captured Shizhang of Han. He attacked and defeated the Zhao general Ni. He attacked and captured twenty-five cities from Yiqu. In the eleventh year, Hui Li Ji attacked Wei's Jiao, which surrendered. He defeated Han at Anmen, beheading ten thousand; their general Xishou fled. Prince Tong was enfeoffed in Shu. The ruler of Yan yielded to his minister Zizhi. In the twelfth year, the king met with the king of Liang at Linjin. The Senior Minister Shuchang Ji attacked Zhao and captured the Zhao general Zhuang. Zhang Yi became prime minister of Chu. In the thirteenth year, the Senior Minister Shuchang Zhang attacked Chu at Danyang, captured their general Qu Gai, and beheaded eighty thousand; he also attacked Chu's Hanzhong, seized six hundred li of territory, and established the Hanzhong commandery. Chu besieged Yongshi. Qin sent the Senior Minister Shuchang Ji to aid Han and attack Qi eastward, and sent Dao Man to aid Wei in attacking Yan. In the fourteenth year, he attacked Chu and captured Zhaoling. Dan and Li submitted. The Shu minister Zhuang killed the Marquis of Shu and came to surrender.

sentences.zh: 惠王卒，子武王立。

translations.text: King Hui died; his son King Wu succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏、齊、楚、越皆賓從。

translations.text: Han, Wei, Qi, Chu, and Yue all came as subjects.
King Hui died; his son King Wu succeeded him. Han, Wei, Qi, Chu, and Yue all came as subjects.

sentences.zh: 武王元年，與魏惠王會臨晉。

translations.text: In the first year of King Wu, he met with King Hui of Wei at Linjin.

sentences.zh: 誅蜀相壯。

translations.text: He executed the Shu minister Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 張儀、魏章皆東出之魏。

translations.text: Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang both went east to Wei.

sentences.zh: 伐義渠、丹、犁。

translations.text: He attacked Yiqu, Dan, and Li.

sentences.zh: 二年，初置丞相，摢裏疾、甘茂為左右丞相。

translations.text: In the second year, the office of Chancellor was first established; Hui Li Ji and Gan Mao became Left and Right Chancellors.

sentences.zh: 張儀死於魏。

translations.text: Zhang Yi died in Wei.

sentences.zh: 三年，與韓襄王會臨晉外。

translations.text: In the third year, he met with King Xiang of Han outside Linjin.

sentences.zh: 南公揭卒，摢裏疾相韓。

translations.text: Nan Gongjie died; Hui Li Ji became prime minister of Han.

sentences.zh: 武王謂甘茂曰：「寡人欲容車通三川，窺周室，死不恨矣。

translations.text: King Wu said to Gan Mao: 'I wish to open a road for chariots through Sanchuan, to look upon the Zhou royal house; then I could die without regret.'

sentences.zh: 」其秋，使甘茂、庶長封伐宜陽。

translations.text: That autumn, he sent Gan Mao and the Senior Minister Shuchang Feng to attack Yiyang.

sentences.zh: 四年，拔宜陽，斬首六萬。

translations.text: In the fourth year, he captured Yiyang, beheading sixty thousand.

sentences.zh: 涉河，城武遂。

translations.text: He crossed the river and fortified Wusui.

sentences.zh: 魏太子來朝。

translations.text: The heir apparent of Wei came to pay court.

sentences.zh: 武王有力好戲，力士任鄙、烏獲、孟說皆至大官。

translations.text: King Wu was strong and loved sport. The strongmen Ren Bi, Wu Huo, and Meng Shuo all rose to high office.

sentences.zh: 王與孟說舉鼎，絕臏。

translations.text: The king competed with Meng Shuo in lifting a tripod and broke his kneecap.

sentences.zh: 八月，武王死。

translations.text: In the eighth month, King Wu died.

sentences.zh: 族孟說。

translations.text: Meng Shuo's entire clan was executed.

sentences.zh: 武王取魏女為后，無子。

translations.text: King Wu had married a woman from Wei as queen, but had no sons.

sentences.zh: 立異母弟，是為昭襄王。

translations.text: His half-brother of a different mother was established; this was King Zhaoxiang.

sentences.zh: 昭襄母楚人，姓羋氏，號宣太后。

translations.text: King Zhaoxiang's mother was a Chu woman, surnamed Mi, known as Queen Dowager Xuan.

sentences.zh: 武王死時，昭襄王為質於燕，燕人送歸，得立。

translations.text: When King Wu died, King Zhaoxiang was a hostage in Yan. The Yan people escorted him back, and he was established.

In the first year of King Wu, he met with King Hui of Wei at Linjin. He executed the Shu minister Zhuang. Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang both went east to Wei. He attacked Yiqu, Dan, and Li. In the second year, the office of Chancellor was first established; Hui Li Ji and Gan Mao became Left and Right Chancellors. Zhang Yi died in Wei. In the third year, he met with King Xiang of Han outside Linjin. Nan Gongjie died; Hui Li Ji became prime minister of Han. King Wu said to Gan Mao: 'I wish to open a road for chariots through Sanchuan, to look upon the Zhou royal house; then I could die without regret.' That autumn, he sent Gan Mao and the Senior Minister Shuchang Feng to attack Yiyang. In the fourth year, he captured Yiyang, beheading sixty thousand. He crossed the river and fortified Wusui. The heir apparent of Wei came to pay court. King Wu was strong and loved sport. The strongmen Ren Bi, Wu Huo, and Meng Shuo all rose to high office. The king competed with Meng Shuo in lifting a tripod and broke his kneecap. In the eighth month, King Wu died. Meng Shuo's entire clan was executed. King Wu had married a woman from Wei as queen, but had no sons. His half-brother of a different mother was established; this was King Zhaoxiang. King Zhaoxiang's mother was a Chu woman, surnamed Mi, known as Queen Dowager Xuan. When King Wu died, King Zhaoxiang was a hostage in Yan. The Yan people escorted him back, and he was established.

sentences.zh: 昭襄王元年，嚴君疾為相。

translations.text: In the first year of King Zhaoxiang, Lord Yan Ji became prime minister.

sentences.zh: 甘茂出之魏。

translations.text: Gan Mao left for Wei.

sentences.zh: 二年，彗星見。

translations.text: In the second year, a comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 庶長壯與大臣、諸侯、公子為逆，皆誅，及惠文后皆不得良死。

translations.text: The Senior Minister Shuchang Zhuang, along with senior ministers, feudal lords, and princes, rebelled. All were executed, and Queen Huiwen also did not die a natural death.

sentences.zh: 悼武王后出歸魏。

translations.text: King Wu's widow was sent back to Wei.

sentences.zh: 三年，王冠。

translations.text: In the third year, the king was capped.

sentences.zh: 與楚王會黃棘，與楚上庸。

translations.text: He met with the king of Chu at Huangji and gave Chu Shangyong.

sentences.zh: 四年，取蒲阪。

translations.text: In the fourth year, he captured Puban.

sentences.zh: 彗星見。

translations.text: A comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 五年，魏王來朝應亭，復與魏蒲阪。

translations.text: In the fifth year, the king of Wei came to pay court at Yingting, and Puban was returned to Wei.

sentences.zh: 六年，蜀侯煇反，司馬錯定蜀。

translations.text: In the sixth year, the Marquis of Shu, Hui, rebelled; Sima Cuo pacified Shu.

sentences.zh: 庶長奐伐楚，斬首二萬。

translations.text: The Senior Minister Shuchang Huan attacked Chu, beheading twenty thousand.

sentences.zh: 涇陽君質於齊。

translations.text: Lord Jingyang was sent as hostage to Qi.

sentences.zh: 日食，晝晦。

translations.text: There was a solar eclipse and daytime darkness.

sentences.zh: 七年，拔新城。

translations.text: In the seventh year, he captured Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 摢裏子卒。

translations.text: Hui Li Zi died.

sentences.zh: 八年，使將軍羋戎攻楚，取新市。

translations.text: In the eighth year, he sent General Mi Rong to attack Chu and capture Xinshi.

sentences.zh: 齊使章子，魏使公孫喜，韓使暴鳶共攻楚方城，取唐眛。

translations.text: Qi sent Zhang Zi, Wei sent Gongsun Xi, and Han sent Bao Yuan to jointly attack Chu's Fangcheng and capture Tangmei.

sentences.zh: 趙破中山，其君亡，竟死齊。

translations.text: Zhao destroyed Zhongshan; its ruler fled and eventually died in Qi.

sentences.zh: 魏公子勁、韓公子長為諸侯。

translations.text: Prince Jin of Wei and Prince Zhang of Han became feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 九年，孟嘗君薛文來相秦。

translations.text: In the ninth year, Mengchang Jun Xue Wen came to be prime minister of Qin.

sentences.zh: 奐攻楚，取八城，殺其將景快。

translations.text: Huan attacked Chu, captured eight cities, and killed their general Jing Kuai.

sentences.zh: 十年，楚懷王入朝秦，秦留之。

translations.text: In the tenth year, King Huai of Chu came to Qin for an audience; Qin detained him.

sentences.zh: 薛文以金受免。

translations.text: Xue Wen was dismissed because he accepted gold.

sentences.zh: 樓緩為丞相。

translations.text: Lou Huan became Chancellor.

sentences.zh: 十一年，齊、韓、魏、趙、宋、中山五國共攻秦，至鹽氏而還。

translations.text: In the eleventh year, Qi, Han, Wei, Zhao, Song, and Zhongshan—five states—jointly attacked Qin, reaching Yanshi before returning.

sentences.zh: 秦與韓、魏河北及封陵以和。

translations.text: Qin gave Han and Wei territory north of the river and Fengling to make peace.

sentences.zh: 彗星見。

translations.text: A comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 楚懷王走之趙，趙不受，還之秦，即死，歸葬。

translations.text: King Huai of Chu fled to Zhao; Zhao refused to receive him and he was returned to Qin, where he died. His body was sent back for burial.

sentences.zh: 十二年，樓緩免，穰侯魏冉為相。

translations.text: In the twelfth year, Lou Huan was dismissed; Marquis Rang Wei Ran became prime minister.

sentences.zh: 予楚粟五萬石。

translations.text: Fifty thousand shi of grain was given to Chu.

In the first year of King Zhaoxiang, Lord Yan Ji became prime minister. Gan Mao left for Wei. In the second year, a comet appeared. The Senior Minister Shuchang Zhuang, along with senior ministers, feudal lords, and princes, rebelled. All were executed, and Queen Huiwen also did not die a natural death. King Wu's widow was sent back to Wei. In the third year, the king was capped. He met with the king of Chu at Huangji and gave Chu Shangyong. In the fourth year, he captured Puban. A comet appeared. In the fifth year, the king of Wei came to pay court at Yingting, and Puban was returned to Wei. In the sixth year, the Marquis of Shu, Hui, rebelled; Sima Cuo pacified Shu. The Senior Minister Shuchang Huan attacked Chu, beheading twenty thousand. Lord Jingyang was sent as hostage to Qi. There was a solar eclipse and daytime darkness. In the seventh year, he captured Xincheng. Hui Li Zi died. In the eighth year, he sent General Mi Rong to attack Chu and capture Xinshi. Qi sent Zhang Zi, Wei sent Gongsun Xi, and Han sent Bao Yuan to jointly attack Chu's Fangcheng and capture Tangmei. Zhao destroyed Zhongshan; its ruler fled and eventually died in Qi. Prince Jin of Wei and Prince Zhang of Han became feudal lords. In the ninth year, Mengchang Jun Xue Wen came to be prime minister of Qin. Huan attacked Chu, captured eight cities, and killed their general Jing Kuai. In the tenth year, King Huai of Chu came to Qin for an audience; Qin detained him. Xue Wen was dismissed because he accepted gold. Lou Huan became Chancellor. In the eleventh year, Qi, Han, Wei, Zhao, Song, and Zhongshan—five states—jointly attacked Qin, reaching Yanshi before returning. Qin gave Han and Wei territory north of the river and Fengling to make peace. A comet appeared. King Huai of Chu fled to Zhao; Zhao refused to receive him and he was returned to Qin, where he died. His body was sent back for burial. In the twelfth year, Lou Huan was dismissed; Marquis Rang Wei Ran became prime minister. Fifty thousand shi of grain was given to Chu.

sentences.zh: 十三年，向壽伐韓，取武始。

translations.text: In the thirteenth year, Xiang Shou attacked Han and captured Wushi.

sentences.zh: 左更白起攻新城。

translations.text: Left Senior Bai Qi attacked Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 五大夫禮出亡奔魏。

translations.text: The Fifth-Rank Minister Li fled to Wei.

sentences.zh: 任鄙為漢中守。

translations.text: Ren Bi became governor of Hanzhong.

sentences.zh: 十四年，左更白起攻韓、魏於伊闕，斬首二十四萬，虜公孫喜，拔五城。

translations.text: In the fourteenth year, Left Senior Bai Qi attacked Han and Wei at Yique, beheading two hundred forty thousand, capturing Gongsun Xi, and taking five cities.

sentences.zh: 十五年，大良造白起攻魏，取垣，復予之。

translations.text: In the fifteenth year, Grand Chief Constructor Bai Qi attacked Wei, captured Yuan, then returned it.

sentences.zh: 攻楚，取宛。

translations.text: He attacked Chu and captured Wan.

sentences.zh: 十六年，左更錯取軹及鄧。

translations.text: In the sixteenth year, Left Senior Cuo captured Zhi and Deng.

sentences.zh: 冉免，封公子市宛，公子悝鄧，魏冉陶，為諸侯。

translations.text: Wei Ran was dismissed. Prince Shi was enfeoffed at Wan, Prince Hui at Deng, and Wei Ran at Tao, as feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 十七年，城陽君入朝，及東周君來朝。

translations.text: In the seventeenth year, the Lord of Chengyang came to pay court, as did the Lord of Eastern Zhou.

sentences.zh: 秦以垣為蒲阪、皮氏。

translations.text: Qin exchanged Yuan for Puban and Pishi.

sentences.zh: 王之宜陽。

translations.text: The king went to Yiyang.

sentences.zh: 十八年，錯攻垣、河雍，決橋取之。

translations.text: In the eighteenth year, Cuo attacked Yuan, Heyong, and took them by breaking the bridge.

sentences.zh: 十九年，王為西帝，齊為東帝，皆復去之。

translations.text: In the nineteenth year, the king became Western Emperor and Qi became Eastern Emperor; both later renounced the titles.

sentences.zh: 呂禮來自歸。

translations.text: Lü Li came to submit himself.

sentences.zh: 齊破宋，宋王在魏，死溫。

translations.text: Qi destroyed Song; the king of Song was in Wei and died at Wen.

sentences.zh: 任鄙卒。

translations.text: Ren Bi died.

sentences.zh: 二十年，王之漢中，又之上郡、北河。

translations.text: In the twentieth year, the king went to Hanzhong, then to Shangjun and the Northern River.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，錯攻魏河內。

translations.text: In the twenty-first year, Cuo attacked Wei's Henei.

sentences.zh: 魏獻安邑，秦出其人，募徙河東賜爵，赦罪人遷之。

translations.text: Wei ceded Anyi. Qin expelled its people, recruited settlers to move to Hedong and granted them ranks, and pardoned criminals who were relocated there.

sentences.zh: 涇陽君封宛。

translations.text: Lord Jingyang was enfeoffed at Wan.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，蒙武伐齊。

translations.text: In the twenty-second year, Meng Wu attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 河東為九縣。

translations.text: Hedong was divided into nine counties.

sentences.zh: 與楚王會宛。

translations.text: He met with the king of Chu at Wan.

sentences.zh: 與趙王會中陽。

translations.text: He met with the king of Zhao at Zhongyang.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，尉斯離與三晉、燕伐齊，破之濟西。

translations.text: In the twenty-third year, Commander Wei Sili, along with the Three Jin and Yan, attacked Qi and defeated them west of the Ji River.

sentences.zh: 王與魏王會宜陽，與韓王會新城。

translations.text: The king met with the king of Wei at Yiyang, and with the king of Han at Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，與楚王會鄢，又會穰。

translations.text: In the twenty-fourth year, he met with the king of Chu at Yan, and again at Rang.

sentences.zh: 秦取魏安城，至大梁，燕、趙救之，秦軍去。

translations.text: Qin captured Ancheng from Wei and reached Daliang. Yan and Zhao came to the rescue, and the Qin army withdrew.

sentences.zh: 魏冉免相。

translations.text: Wei Ran was dismissed as prime minister.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，拔趙二城。

translations.text: In the twenty-fifth year, he captured two cities from Zhao.

sentences.zh: 與韓王會新城，與魏王會新明邑。

translations.text: He met with the king of Han at Xincheng, and with the king of Wei at Xinmingyi.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，赦罪人遷之穰。

translations.text: In the twenty-sixth year, pardoned criminals were relocated to Rang.

sentences.zh: 侯冉復相。

translations.text: Marquis Wei Ran was again made prime minister.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，錯攻楚。

translations.text: In the twenty-seventh year, Cuo attacked Chu.

sentences.zh: 赦罪人遷之南陽。

translations.text: Pardoned criminals were relocated to Nanyang.

sentences.zh: 白起攻趙，取代光狼城。

translations.text: Bai Qi attacked Zhao and captured the city of Dai Guanglang.

sentences.zh: 又使司馬錯發隴西，因蜀攻楚黔中，拔之。

translations.text: He also sent Sima Cuo to set out from Longxi and, using Shu as a base, to attack Chu's Qianzhong, which he captured.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，大良造白起攻楚，取鄢、鄧，赦罪人遷之。

translations.text: In the twenty-eighth year, Grand Chief Constructor Bai Qi attacked Chu and captured Yan and Deng; pardoned criminals were relocated there.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，大良造白起攻楚，取郢為南郡，楚王走。

translations.text: In the twenty-ninth year, Grand Chief Constructor Bai Qi attacked Chu and captured Ying, making it the Nan Commandery. The king of Chu fled.

sentences.zh: 周君來。

translations.text: The Lord of Zhou came.

sentences.zh: 王與楚王會襄陵。

translations.text: The king met with the king of Chu at Xiangling.

sentences.zh: 白起為武安君。

translations.text: Bai Qi was made Lord of Wu'an.

sentences.zh: 三十年，蜀守若伐楚，取巫郡，及江南為黔中郡。

translations.text: In the thirtieth year, the Shu governor Ruo attacked Chu, captured the Wu Commandery, and made the area south of the river the Qianzhong Commandery.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，白起伐魏，取兩城。

translations.text: In the thirty-first year, Bai Qi attacked Wei and captured two cities.

sentences.zh: 楚人反我江南。

translations.text: The Chu people took back our territory south of the river.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，相穰侯攻魏，至大梁，破暴鳶，斬首四萬，鳶走，魏入三縣請和。

translations.text: In the thirty-second year, Prime Minister Marquis Rang attacked Wei, reaching Daliang, defeated Bao Yuan, beheaded forty thousand, and Bao Yuan fled. Wei ceded three counties to sue for peace.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，客卿胡（傷）［陽］攻魏卷、蔡陽、長社，取之。

translations.text: In the thirty-third year, the guest minister Hu Yang attacked Wei's Juan, Caiyang, and Changshe, and captured them.

sentences.zh: 擊芒卯華陽，破之，斬首十五萬。

translations.text: He struck Mang Mao at Huayang and defeated him, beheading one hundred fifty thousand.

sentences.zh: 魏入南陽以和。

translations.text: Wei ceded Nanyang to make peace.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，秦與魏、韓上庸地為一郡，南陽免臣遷居之。

translations.text: In the thirty-fourth year, Qin, Wei, and Han combined the Shangyong territory into one commandery, and freed servants from Nanyang were relocated there.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，佐韓、魏、楚伐燕。

translations.text: In the thirty-fifth year, he assisted Han, Wei, and Chu in attacking Yan.

sentences.zh: 初置南陽郡。

translations.text: The Nanyang Commandery was first established.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，客卿灶攻齊，取剛、壽，予穰侯。

translations.text: In the thirty-sixth year, the guest minister Zao attacked Qi and captured Gang and Shou, which were given to Marquis Rang.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，中更胡（傷）［陽］攻趙閼與，不能取。

translations.text: In the thirty-eighth year, Middle Senior Hu Yang attacked Zhao's Eyu but could not capture it.

sentences.zh: 四十年，悼太子死魏，歸葬芷陽。

translations.text: In the fortieth year, the Mourning Heir Apparent died in Wei; his body was returned and buried at Zhiyang.

sentences.zh: 四十一年夏，攻魏，取邢丘、懷。

translations.text: In the summer of the forty-first year, he attacked Wei and captured Xingqiu and Huai.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，安國君為太子。

translations.text: In the forty-second year, Lord Anguo was made heir apparent.

sentences.zh: 十月，宣太后薨，葬芷陽酈山。

translations.text: In the tenth month, Queen Dowager Xuan died and was buried at Zhiyang on Mount Li.

sentences.zh: 九月，穰侯出之陶。

translations.text: In the ninth month, Marquis Rang departed for Tao.

sentences.zh: 四十三年，武安君白起攻韓，拔九城，斬首五萬。

translations.text: In the forty-third year, Lord of Wu'an Bai Qi attacked Han, captured nine cities, and beheaded fifty thousand.

sentences.zh: 四十四年，攻韓南（郡）［陽］，取之。

translations.text: In the forty-fourth year, he attacked Han's Nanyang and captured it.

sentences.zh: 四十五年，五大夫賁攻韓，取十城。

translations.text: In the forty-fifth year, the Fifth-Rank Minister Ben attacked Han and captured ten cities.

sentences.zh: 葉陽君悝出之國，未至而死。

translations.text: Lord Yeyang Hui departed for his state but died before arriving.

sentences.zh: 四十七年，秦攻韓上黨，上黨降趙，秦因攻趙，趙發兵擊秦，相距。

translations.text: In the forty-seventh year, Qin attacked Han's Shangdang. Shangdang surrendered to Zhao, so Qin then attacked Zhao. Zhao dispatched troops to strike Qin, and they faced off against each other.

sentences.zh: 秦使武安君白起擊，大破趙於長平，四十餘萬盡殺之。

translations.text: Qin sent Lord of Wu'an Bai Qi to attack, and he utterly defeated Zhao at Changping, killing all of more than four hundred thousand.

sentences.zh: 四十八年十月，韓獻垣雍。

translations.text: In the tenth month of the forty-eighth year, Han offered Yuanyong.

sentences.zh: 秦軍分為三軍。

translations.text: The Qin army was divided into three forces.

sentences.zh: 武安君歸。

translations.text: Lord of Wu'an returned.

sentences.zh: 王龁將伐趙（武安）皮牢，拔之。

translations.text: Wang He led an attack on Zhao's Pilao and captured it.

sentences.zh: 司馬梗北定太原，盡有韓上黨。

translations.text: Sima Geng pacified Taiyuan in the north, and all of Han's Shangdang was annexed.

sentences.zh: 正月，兵罷，復守上黨。

translations.text: In the first month, the troops were dismissed and returned to defend Shangdang.

sentences.zh: 其十月，五大夫陵攻趙邯鄲。

translations.text: In the tenth month, Fifth-Rank Minister Ling attacked Zhao's Handan.

sentences.zh: 四十九年正月，益發卒佐陵。

translations.text: In the first month of the forty-ninth year, more troops were dispatched to assist Ling.

sentences.zh: 陵戰不善，免，王龁代將。

translations.text: Ling fought poorly and was dismissed; Wang He took command.

sentences.zh: 其十月，將軍張唐攻魏，為蔡尉捐弗守，還斬之。

translations.text: In the tenth month, General Zhang Tang attacked Wei. Commander Cai Wei Juanfu did not defend, and upon returning, he was executed.

sentences.zh: 五十年十月，武安君白起有罪，為士伍，遷陰密。

translations.text: In the tenth month of the fiftieth year, Lord of Wu'an Bai Qi was found guilty, demoted to the rank of common soldier, and exiled to Yinmi.

sentences.zh: 張唐攻鄭，拔之。

translations.text: Zhang Tang attacked Zheng and captured it.

sentences.zh: 十二月，益發卒軍汾城旁。

translations.text: In the twelfth month, more troops were dispatched to the army near Fencheng.

sentences.zh: 武安君白起有罪，死。

translations.text: Lord of Wu'an Bai Qi was found guilty and executed.

sentences.zh: 龁攻邯鄲，不拔，去，還奔汾軍。

translations.text: Wang He attacked Handan but could not capture it; he withdrew and fled to join the army at Fen.

sentences.zh: 二月餘攻晉軍，斬首六千，晉楚流死河二萬人。

translations.text: After two months of attacking the Jin army, he beheaded six thousand, and twenty thousand Jin and Chu soldiers drowned in the river.

sentences.zh: 攻汾城，即從唐拔寧新中，寧新中更名安陽。

translations.text: He attacked Fencheng, then followed Tang to capture Ningxinzhong; Ningxinzhong was renamed Anyang.

sentences.zh: 初作河橋。

translations.text: The first river bridge was built.

In the thirteenth year, Xiang Shou attacked Han and captured Wushi. Left Senior Bai Qi attacked Xincheng. The Fifth-Rank Minister Li fled to Wei. Ren Bi became governor of Hanzhong. In the fourteenth year, Left Senior Bai Qi attacked Han and Wei at Yique, beheading two hundred forty thousand, capturing Gongsun Xi, and taking five cities. In the fifteenth year, Grand Chief Constructor Bai Qi attacked Wei, captured Yuan, then returned it. He attacked Chu and captured Wan. In the sixteenth year, Left Senior Cuo captured Zhi and Deng. Wei Ran was dismissed. Prince Shi was enfeoffed at Wan, Prince Hui at Deng, and Wei Ran at Tao, as feudal lords. In the seventeenth year, the Lord of Chengyang came to pay court, as did the Lord of Eastern Zhou. Qin exchanged Yuan for Puban and Pishi. The king went to Yiyang. In the eighteenth year, Cuo attacked Yuan, Heyong, and took them by breaking the bridge. In the nineteenth year, the king became Western Emperor and Qi became Eastern Emperor; both later renounced the titles. Lü Li came to submit himself. Qi destroyed Song; the king of Song was in Wei and died at Wen. Ren Bi died. In the twentieth year, the king went to Hanzhong, then to Shangjun and the Northern River. In the twenty-first year, Cuo attacked Wei's Henei. Wei ceded Anyi. Qin expelled its people, recruited settlers to move to Hedong and granted them ranks, and pardoned criminals who were relocated there. Lord Jingyang was enfeoffed at Wan. In the twenty-second year, Meng Wu attacked Qi. Hedong was divided into nine counties. He met with the king of Chu at Wan. He met with the king of Zhao at Zhongyang. In the thirtieth year, the Shu governor Ruo attacked Chu, captured the Wu Commandery, and made the area south of the river the Qianzhong Commandery. In the thirty-eighth year, Middle Senior Hu Yang attacked Zhao's Eyu but could not capture it. In the fortieth year, the Mourning Heir Apparent died in Wei; his body was returned and buried at Zhiyang. In the summer of the forty-first year, he attacked Wei and captured Xingqiu and Huai. In the forty-second year, Lord Anguo was made heir apparent. In the tenth month, Queen Dowager Xuan died and was buried at Zhiyang on Mount Li. In the ninth month, Marquis Rang departed for Tao. In the forty-third year, Lord of Wu'an Bai Qi attacked Han, captured nine cities, and beheaded fifty thousand. In the forty-fourth year, he attacked Han's Nanyang and captured it. In the forty-fifth year, the Fifth-Rank Minister Ben attacked Han and captured ten cities. Lord Yeyang Hui departed for his state but died before arriving. Qin sent Lord of Wu'an Bai Qi to attack, and he utterly defeated Zhao at Changping, killing all of more than four hundred thousand. In the tenth month of the forty-eighth year, Han offered Yuanyong. Sima Geng pacified Taiyuan in the north, and all of Han's Shangdang was annexed. In the first month, the troops were dismissed and returned to defend Shangdang. In the tenth month, Fifth-Rank Minister Ling attacked Zhao's Handan. In the first month of the forty-ninth year, more troops were dispatched to assist Ling. Ling fought poorly and was dismissed; Wang He took command. In the tenth month, General Zhang Tang attacked Wei. Commander Cai Wei Juanfu did not defend, and upon returning, he was executed. In the tenth month of the fiftieth year, Lord of Wu'an Bai Qi was found guilty, demoted to the rank of common soldier, and exiled to Yinmi. Zhang Tang attacked Zheng and captured it. In the twelfth month, more troops were dispatched to the army near Fencheng. Lord of Wu'an Bai Qi was found guilty and executed. Wang He attacked Handan but could not capture it; he withdrew and fled to join the army at Fen. After two months of attacking the Jin army, he beheaded six thousand, and twenty thousand Jin and Chu soldiers drowned in the river. He attacked Fencheng, then followed Tang to capture Ningxinzhong; Ningxinzhong was renamed Anyang. The first river bridge was built.

sentences.zh: 五十一年，將軍摎攻韓，取陽城、負黍，斬首四萬。

translations.text: In the fifty-first year, General Jiu attacked Han and captured Yangcheng and Fushu, beheading forty thousand.

sentences.zh: 攻趙，取二十餘縣，首虜九萬。

translations.text: He attacked Zhao and captured more than twenty counties, with ninety thousand killed or captured.

sentences.zh: 西周君背秦，與諸侯約從，將天下銳兵出伊闕攻秦，令秦毋得通陽城。

translations.text: The Lord of Western Zhou turned against Qin and made an alliance with the feudal lords, intending to bring the best troops of all under heaven out of Yique to attack Qin, ordering that Qin should not be allowed to reach Yangcheng.

sentences.zh: 於是秦使將軍摎攻西周。

translations.text: Thereupon Qin sent General Jiu to attack Western Zhou.

sentences.zh: 西周君走來自歸，頓首受罪，盡獻其邑三十六城，口三萬。

translations.text: The Lord of Western Zhou came running to surrender, prostrating himself and confessing his crimes, offering all his thirty-six towns with thirty thousand inhabitants.

sentences.zh: 秦王受獻，歸其君於周。

translations.text: The King of Qin accepted the surrender and returned the lord to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 五十二年，周民東亡，其器九鼎入秦。

translations.text: In the fifty-second year, the people of Zhou fled eastward, and the Nine Tripods entered Qin.

sentences.zh: 周初亡。

translations.text: Zhou was first destroyed.

In the fifty-first year, General Jiu attacked Han and captured Yangcheng and Fushu, beheading forty thousand. He attacked Zhao and captured more than twenty counties, with ninety thousand killed or captured. The Lord of Western Zhou turned against Qin and made an alliance with the feudal lords, intending to bring the best troops of all under heaven out of Yique to attack Qin, ordering that Qin should not be allowed to reach Yangcheng. Thereupon Qin sent General Jiu to attack Western Zhou. The Lord of Western Zhou came running to surrender, prostrating himself and confessing his crimes, offering all his thirty-six towns with thirty thousand inhabitants. The King of Qin accepted the surrender and returned the lord to Zhou. In the fifty-second year, the people of Zhou fled eastward, and the Nine Tripods entered Qin. Zhou was first destroyed.

sentences.zh: 五十三年，天下來賓。

translations.text: In the fifty-third year, all under heaven came to submit.

sentences.zh: 魏後，秦使摎伐魏，取吳城。

translations.text: Wei was last; Qin sent Jiu to attack Wei and capture Wucheng.

sentences.zh: 韓王入朝，魏委國聽令。

translations.text: The king of Han came to pay court; Wei entrusted its state and obeyed orders.

sentences.zh: 五十四年，王郊見上帝於雍。

translations.text: In the fifty-fourth year, the king made a suburban sacrifice to the Supreme Deity at Yong.

sentences.zh: 五十六年秋，昭襄王卒，子孝文王立。

translations.text: In the autumn of the fifty-sixth year, King Zhaoxiang died; his son King Xiaowen succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 尊唐八子為唐太后，而合其葬於先王。

translations.text: He honored the Consort Tang Bazi as Queen Dowager Tang, and had her buried together with the former king.

sentences.zh: 韓王衰绖入弔祠，諸侯皆使其將相來弔祠，視喪事。

translations.text: The king of Han came in mourning clothes to offer condolences and sacrifices; all the feudal lords sent their generals and ministers to offer condolences and attend to the funeral.

In the fifty-third year, all under heaven came to submit. Wei was last; Qin sent Jiu to attack Wei and capture Wucheng. The king of Han came to pay court; Wei entrusted its state and obeyed orders. In the fifty-fourth year, the king made a suburban sacrifice to the Supreme Deity at Yong. In the autumn of the fifty-sixth year, King Zhaoxiang died; his son King Xiaowen succeeded him. He honored the Consort Tang Bazi as Queen Dowager Tang, and had her buried together with the former king. The king of Han came in mourning clothes to offer condolences and sacrifices; all the feudal lords sent their generals and ministers to offer condolences and attend to the funeral.

sentences.zh: 孝文王元年，赦罪人，修先王功臣，褒厚親戚，弛苑囿。

translations.text: In the first year of King Xiaowen, criminals were pardoned, the meritorious ministers of former kings were honored, relatives were treated generously, and the hunting parks were opened.

sentences.zh: 孝文王除喪，十月己亥即位，三日辛醜卒，子莊襄王立。

translations.text: King Xiaowen ended his mourning period, was enthroned on the yihai day of the tenth month, and died three days later on the xinzhou day. His son King Zhuangxiang succeeded him.

In the first year of King Xiaowen, criminals were pardoned, the meritorious ministers of former kings were honored, relatives were treated generously, and the hunting parks were opened. King Xiaowen ended his mourning period, was enthroned on the yihai day of the tenth month, and died three days later on the xinzhou day. His son King Zhuangxiang succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 莊襄王元年，大赦罪人，修先王功臣，施德厚骨肉而布惠於民。

translations.text: In the first year of King Zhuangxiang, there was a great amnesty for criminals, meritorious ministers of former kings were honored, kindness was extended to relatives, and benevolence was spread to the people.

sentences.zh: 東周君與諸侯謀秦，秦使相國呂不韋誅之，盡入其國。

translations.text: The Lord of Eastern Zhou conspired with the feudal lords against Qin. Qin sent Prime Minister Lü Buwei to execute him and annexed his entire state.

sentences.zh: 秦不絕其祀，以陽人地賜周君，奉其祭祀。

translations.text: Qin did not end his sacrifices, but granted the Lord of Zhou the territory of Yangren to maintain his ancestral worship.

sentences.zh: 使蒙驁伐韓，韓獻成皋、鞏。

translations.text: Meng Ao was sent to attack Han; Han ceded Chenggao and Gong.

sentences.zh: 秦界至大梁，初置三川郡。

translations.text: Qin's border reached Daliang; the Sanchuan Commandery was first established.

sentences.zh: 二年，使蒙驁攻趙，定太原。

translations.text: In the second year, Meng Ao was sent to attack Zhao and pacified Taiyuan.

sentences.zh: 三年，蒙驁攻魏高都、汲，拔之。

translations.text: In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Wei's Gaodu and Ji and captured them.

sentences.zh: 攻趙榆次、新城、狼孟，取三十七城。

translations.text: He attacked Zhao's Yuci, Xincheng, and Langmeng, taking thirty-seven cities.

sentences.zh: 四月日食。

translations.text: In the fourth month, there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: （四年）王龁攻上黨。

translations.text: Wang He attacked Shangdang.

sentences.zh: 初置太原郡。

translations.text: The Taiyuan Commandery was first established.

sentences.zh: 魏將無忌率五國兵擊秦，秦卻於河外。

translations.text: Wuji, general of Wei, led the troops of five states to attack Qin; Qin retreated beyond the river.

sentences.zh: 蒙驁敗，解而去。

translations.text: Meng Ao was defeated and withdrew.

sentences.zh: 五月丙午，莊襄王卒，子政立，是為秦始皇帝。

translations.text: On the bingwu day of the fifth month, King Zhuangxiang died; his son Zheng succeeded him. This was the First Emperor of Qin.

In the first year of King Zhuangxiang, there was a great amnesty for criminals, meritorious ministers of former kings were honored, kindness was extended to relatives, and benevolence was spread to the people. The Lord of Eastern Zhou conspired with the feudal lords against Qin. Qin sent Prime Minister Lü Buwei to execute him and annexed his entire state. Qin did not end his sacrifices, but granted the Lord of Zhou the territory of Yangren to maintain his ancestral worship. Meng Ao was sent to attack Han; Han ceded Chenggao and Gong. Qin's border reached Daliang; the Sanchuan Commandery was first established. In the second year, Meng Ao was sent to attack Zhao and pacified Taiyuan. In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Wei's Gaodu and Ji and captured them. He attacked Zhao's Yuci, Xincheng, and Langmeng, taking thirty-seven cities. In the fourth month, there was a solar eclipse. Wang He attacked Shangdang. The Taiyuan Commandery was first established. Wuji, general of Wei, led the troops of five states to attack Qin; Qin retreated beyond the river. Meng Ao was defeated and withdrew. On the bingwu day of the fifth month, King Zhuangxiang died; his son Zheng succeeded him. This was the First Emperor of Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦王政立二十六年，初并天下為三十六郡，號為始皇帝。

translations.text: King Zheng of Qin ruled for twenty-six years, first unified all under heaven into thirty-six commanderies, and took the title First Emperor.

sentences.zh: 始皇帝五十一年而崩，子胡亥立，是為二世皇帝。

translations.text: The First Emperor ruled for fifty-one years and died; his son Huhai succeeded him. This was the Second Emperor.

sentences.zh: 三年，諸侯并起叛秦，趙高殺二世，立子嬰。

translations.text: In the third year, the feudal lords all rose up in rebellion against Qin. Zhao Gao killed the Second Emperor and established Ziying.

sentences.zh: 子嬰立月餘，諸侯誅之，遂滅秦。

translations.text: Ziying had been established for just over a month when the feudal lords executed him, and Qin was thereupon destroyed.

sentences.zh: 其語在始皇本紀中。

translations.text: This account is found in the Basic Annals of the First Emperor.

King Zheng of Qin ruled for twenty-six years, first unified all under heaven into thirty-six commanderies, and took the title First Emperor. The First Emperor ruled for fifty-one years and died; his son Huhai succeeded him. This was the Second Emperor. In the third year, the feudal lords all rose up in rebellion against Qin. Zhao Gao killed the Second Emperor and established Ziying. Ziying had been established for just over a month when the feudal lords executed him, and Qin was thereupon destroyed. This account is found in the Basic Annals of the First Emperor.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：秦之先為嬴姓。

translations.text: The Grand Historian says: The ancestors of Qin bore the surname Ying.

sentences.zh: 其後分封，以國為姓，有徐氏、郯氏、莒氏、終黎氏、運奄氏、菟裘氏、將梁氏、黃氏、江氏、修魚氏、白冥氏、蜚廉氏、秦氏。

translations.text: Their descendants were later enfeoffed and took their states as surnames, including the Xu clan, the Tan clan, the Ju clan, the Zhongli clan, the Yunyan clan, the Tuqiu clan, the Jiangliang clan, the Huang clan, the Jiang clan, the Xiuyu clan, the Baiming clan, the Feilian clan, and the Qin clan.

sentences.zh: 然秦以其先造父封趙城，為趙氏。

translations.text: However, Qin took the surname Zhao because their ancestor Zaofu was enfeoffed with the city of Zhao.

The Grand Historian says: The ancestors of Qin bore the surname Ying. Their descendants were later enfeoffed and took their states as surnames, including the Xu clan, the Tan clan, the Ju clan, the Zhongli clan, the Yunyan clan, the Tuqiu clan, the Jiangliang clan, the Huang clan, the Jiang clan, the Xiuyu clan, the Baiming clan, the Feilian clan, and the Qin clan. However, Qin took the surname Zhao because their ancestor Zaofu was enfeoffed with the city of Zhao.
